III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327
Section (1) Upon receipt of any information that relates to possible
Description noncompliance with any foster home rule, the agency must
do all the following:
(b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as
soon as is indicated, based on the information
received, but not later than 7 calendar days after
receipt of the information.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency did not investigate possible foster home rule violations by
Foster Parent 1.
Investigation
Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant by phone on 12/30/2024.
Complainant reported making reports of possible rule violations by
Foster Parent and the agency did not investigate the allegations.
Complainant stated Foster Parent does take difficult children for
placement. Complainant described Foster Parent as the worst
foster parent ever. Complainant reported Complainant does not
think adequate supervision is being provided because one youth
in the home jumped out the youth's bedroom window and had to
be taken for medical treatment.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 01/02/2025.
Chief Administrator reported several special evaluations have
been completed or are in process regarding the care provided for
youth by Foster Parent. Chief Administrator stated Foster Parent
does provide care for difficult youth and that is a contributing
factor as to why this foster home/foster parent has a higher
number of special evaluations/allegations.
2

I interviewed Licensee Designee by telephone on 03/03/2025.
Licensee Designee described the situation similar to the
description reported by Chief Administrator. Licensee Designee
stated the agency has replaced one of the certification workers to
better assist in the timely completion of foster home special
evaluations.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the foster home record for Foster Parent. The record
indicated several special evaluations have been completed or are
in process. Evaluations were reviewed as follows:
02/20/24 #2024SEC0001358
Allegation of possible physical abuse
Completed/Compliance
07/11/24 #2024SEC0001744
Allegation youth locked out of the home and wandering the streets
Completed/Compliance
08/20/24 #2024SEC0001842
Allegations related to youth behaviors and peer aggression
Completed/Compliance
10/30/24 #2025SEC0000092
Allegation female youth is pregnant
Completed/Compliance
01/27/25 #2025SEC0000178
Allegation related to a youth jumping out a window
Investigation in progress
12/18/24 #2025SEC0000224
Allegation related to caregivers’ level of participation in treatment
plans, meetings, and wrap-around services, youth jumping out a
window, and a female youth’s pregnancy
Investigation in progress
01/27/2025 #2025SEC0000330
Allegation regarding adequate/appropriate alternate caregiver
Investigation in progress
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews and
records/documents reviewed. It is evident that a number of
allegations have been made related to the care provided by Foster
3

Parent, but the allegations have been or are being investigated by
the agency as required by this rule. Information system
documentation indicated each of the investigations were initiated
within the 7 calendar day time period established by this rule.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
